divs: sighting detailsmy wife and i were driving east bound on duhon rd (rt 724), to johnston st (hwy 167) around 8pm. i noticed an arc of lights (approximately 8-12 in number) flying low in the sky at my 1 o'clock position. the lights at first reminded me of a flock of herons flying in a loose formation--relatively low and slow. once i realized that 1) it was completely dark and 2) that the lights shifted or upon closer inspection were in a arc\boomerang pattern, and 3) equally distributed along the front of an apparent boomerang, black shape; i thought to myself -- a ufo???! i pointed and said to my wife, "what the heck...what is that?", just as the object dimmed off it's lights--almost like going into a cloud at my 2 o'clock position. my wife did not see the lights, but saw the boomerang object, eerily contrasted against the clear, black sky. the object kept a constant speed and elevation throughout the sighting, but we lost track of the object once the lights were completely off and as we approached the intersection with street lights and traffic lights. i was a little freaked out at first, but was freaked out more when my wife saw it and couldn't explain it either. we were somewhat exhilarated by the experience too. total time from seeing the lights to vanishing of the object was probably about 10 seconds. later after looking at a map, the object was probably between 167 and the vermilion river. it could have been a southwest bound plane from the lft, but it looked too big and no other common blinking airplane lights were witness before, during or after the sighting.
trends: There have been 7 other sightings in Lafayette
There were no other sightings in Lafayette on or around October 31st 2009
Summary: Arc shape of lights on dark/black boomerang object flying low and slow.
